tool.name: SAGA.ta_morphometry.12
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayDEM False output_data_DAH $output_data_DAH name SAGA.ta_morphometry.12 DEM $DEM ALPHA_MAX $ALPHA_MAX prefer $prefer response $response outputType_DAH $OutputSection_DAH.outputType_DAH transmissionMode_DAH $OutputSection_DAH.transmissionMode_DAH

param.name: DEM
param.label: Elevation
param.help: Elevation The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-aaigrid, x-ogc-envi, tiff, png

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_DAH
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_DAH
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: This tool calculates a rather simple approximation of the anisotropic diurnal heat (Ha) distribution using the formula:<br/><b>Ha = cos(amax - a) * arctan(b)</b><br/>where <i>amax</i> defines the aspect with the maximum total heat surplus, <i>a</i> is the slope aspect and <i>b</i> is the slope angle. For more details see Boehner & Antonic (2009).
